page.title: 01South Herefordshire c'side
page.content: The block slopes gently towards the north, and its southern ridge gives good distant views of clee Hill, Bringewood Chase and High Vinnals. It is farming country, with small fields, hedges and many hedgerow trees. communications are by a number of narrow lanes, used by farmers' machinary and by the local residents' cars. The village has no actual centre; the houses and cottages are guite evenly distributed over the area of the partish. The church stands in a fairly isolated position. In recent years two large-scale turkey breeding units have been established. A number of the cottages have been renovated during the past few years and are now occupied by newcomers to the village.
